title: Fish Trail Criterium
description: Fish Trails Criterium Downtown Whitefish, MT. June 7th 2008
course: Clean, fast course with eight turns! Two more turns than last year.  The course is wide, the pavement is buff and the corners are clean.  The start and finish area is be on Depot St. in between the Train Station and Depot Park.
registration: Pre-register online at www.Sportsbaseonline.com or on June 6th at Great Northern Cycles 104 O’Brien Ave Whitefish, MT 5:00pm-6:00pm or at the event on June 7th 9:30am-10:30am at Depot Park in Whitefish, MT.
notes: Numbers will be worn on the LEFT side.  All USAC rules apply.  Helmets are required at all time when on your bike, warm-up, while racing and cool-down.  Bar end caps are mandatory.
directions: Riders will use the O\'Shaughnessy Center Parking Lot in downtown Whitefish.  Registration with be in the theater courtyard.  The O\'Shaughnessy Center is located on the corner of Central Ave. and Railroad St.

title: Granja del Cerdo XC and Single Speed Race
description:
Granja del Cerdo Cross Country Mtb. and Single Speed Race
June 21, 2008 Whitefish, MT
Beginner, Sport, Expert, Single Speed and Clydesdale Classes
Pork Products to the winners!
course: Course is an undulating mixture of forested single and double track. Short steep climbs, technical root sections and sharp cornering.  Beginners one lap, Sport, Single Speed and Clydesdale two laps and Expert three laps.
registration: Register online at Sportsbaseonline.com or at Great Northern Cycles in Whitefish, MT on Friday 6/20/08 4pm-6pm or at the race Saturday 6/21/08 9am-11am.
notes:
All riders must present a valid USAC license at registration.  1 day licenses and annual USAC licenses will also be available at the event. For more information about USAC visit the USAC web site at www.usacycling.org.
All riders must wear a helmet at all times while participating in this event. Eye protection and gloves are strongly recommended. Riders should also carry their own spare tube, patch kit, tools, and water bottles. This event is held on public state land.  Your help with minimizing our impact is greatly appreciated. This event is produced by volunteers proceeds go toward toward the Great Northern Cycling Junior Racing Program.
directions: The event is being held on a piece of public land locally know as The Pig Farm which is located in between Whitefish and Kalispell, MT.  Traveling north out of Kalispell on US HWY 93 turn left on KM Ranch Rd (approximately 5 miles).  Traveling south out of Whitefish on US HWY 93 turn right onto KM Ranch Rd (approximately 4 miles).  Once on KM Ranch Rd. travel approx. 3/4 mile and take a soft left onto Spring Prairie RD. Travel west approx 1 mile.  Turn right on Kuhns Rd. until it intersects with Farm to Market Rd. turn Right.  The event registration area is approx. 1/4 mile on the left side of the road.  Park in an open lot on the south east corner of Kuhns Rd and Farm to Market and ride to registration.  Please car pool if possible parking is limited.

title: Eden Road Race - MT State RR Championships
Woodland "Cross
description: The Race will be held at Woodland Park Kalispell
course: The course is mix of grass, asphalt, jagged rock, hard pack single track and one medium sized run-up.
registration: Race Day registration opens at 8:30 and close at 10:15.  $20.OO race fee, Juniors race free.
notes:
· USCF license required. Cat 4 men and women without a 2008 annual license must purchase a one-day
license for $10. All other categories must have an annual license.
· Promoters reserve the right to combine classes
directions: From Hwy 93 turn East onto Hwy 2 for 1 mile, turn Right onto Woodland Park Drive for .25 miles, turn right at Woodland Park
